meanings.definition: To make a ticking sound, as a clock.
meanings.sent1: The old clock ticktocked loudly in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: The metronome ticktocked rhythmically during the music lesson.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat ticktocked around the house, pretending to be a clock.
meanings.sent4: Time ticktocked away, reminding her of the impending deadline.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the clock ticktocked in her ears, lulling her to sleep.

meanings.definition: Past tense of ticktock: to move or progress steadily and regularly, like the ticking of a clock.
meanings.sent1: The train ticktocked along the tracks, carrying passengers to their destination.
meanings.sent2: His heart ticktocked with excitement as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent3: The little ducklings ticktocked behind their mother in a straight line.
meanings.sent4: The days ticktocked by, each one similar to the last.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum of the grandfather clock ticktocked back and forth, marking the passage of time.
